name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL – RETAINING WALLS

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Stonestrong blocks to be supplied by an approved supplier. The Contractor shall liaise with the Principal-appointed Cultural Artist to coordinate carving of the supplied blanks and the  production of moulds & blocks
Verifying Document - Conforming Molds Post Carving

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Backfill is to comprise a well graded, granular material such as GAP65 or site won Hinuera Sand, which must be free of any deleterious material. Sand backfill shall have a fines content (less than 0.075mm diameter) of no more than 10%. Labratory MDD (x2 per material type) at standard compaction
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geogrid to be Miragrid GX200/30 or similar approved
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Paraweb to be the correct grade: Paraweb 2D-50
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Shall be 110mm diameter NZTA F/2 compliant smooth bore perforated corrugated pipe with filter sock
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Shall be Cirtex Armour flow, or similar accepted by the Engineer

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The foundation materials are to comprise natural Hinuera sand material, stiff Hinuera Silt or imported clean sand and must achieve a minimum of 4 blows per 100mm when tested with a Scala penetrometer. Any exposed silts must have vane shear strengths greater than 70kPa.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Results of the foundation material testing shall be supplied to the Engineer for approval and the prepared ground shall be inspected by the Engineer. Construction may not proceed until receiving Engineer’s approval.
Frequency - Prior to proceeding. Min 48h notice to Engineer

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Any unsuitable materials, such as uncontrolled fill, contaminated materials or any weak or organic materials, shall be undercut and replaced with compacted granular fill (WHAP65 or equivalent) or Hinuera Sand. Surveyor to capture extent of undercut (if any) to include in asbuilt.
Verifying Document - Survey Record/ Photo record
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM (DT 300mm deep or backscatter with GAP65), with MDD of 95% or greater
Frequency - 1 per 500m3 with at least 1 test per 0.5m lift per 20m run of wall

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geotextiles shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets. Engineer to inspect 1 layer prior to backfill.
Frequency - Each layer - 1 layer per abutment to be inspected
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All backfill is to be installed in 250mm lifts and compacted to the following standards.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM (DT 300mm deep or backscatter with GAP65), with MDD of 95% or greater
Frequency - 1 per 500m3 with at least 1 test per 0.5m lift per 20m run of wall
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Proofroll of each layer. 4 Cleggs to be undertaken per NDM test. Engineer to proofroll/inspect final layer of load transfer platform.
Frequency - Each layer - final layer to be inspected
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum average value over 5 tests of 5 blows per 100mm, minimum single value of 4 blows per 100mm
Frequency - 1 per 500m3, 1 test per 0.5m lift per 20m run of wall

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall construct a 200 mm thick levelling pad on top of the load transfer platform to create a level founding platform to accept the MSE retaining wall.
Frequency - Prior to Stone Strong block installation
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Blocks to be installed to the height and location as detailed on the construction drawings. The table below details acceptable tollerances.
Element || Vertical Position || Horizontal Position || Vertical Alignment || Horizontal Alignment
Facings and wall structures || ± 50mm || ± 50mm || ± 20mm in 3m || ± 20mm in 3m
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The correct number of parawebs are to be installed as shown on the construction drawings.

○ Para web is to be placed flat or with a 1% fall toward the rear of the wall. The Para web must be free of wrinkles and lightly tensioned prior to and during placement of backfill. Shallow trench to be dug toward the end of the paraweb, pin to be used to pull paraweb taught prior to backfilling.
○ The Para web must be continuous over the design embedment length and no joins are permitted unless adequately lapped and spliced according to the Manufacturer’s instructions.
○ 150mm of fill cover is required before construction equipment can travel over the area

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geocomposite drainage board shall be installed continuously along the back face of the block facing of all MSE retaining walls using an approved adhesive recommended by the manufacturer. Check for correct layout, orientation, and any damage prior to backfilling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage pipe wraped in filter sock to be installed along the base of the wall. Drainage outlets shall be connected to the reticulated stormwater system or other approved outlet structure at the discretion of the design engineer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All backfill is to be installed in 250mm lifts adnd compacted to the following standards.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM (DT 300mm deep or backscatter with GAP65), with MDD of 95% or greater
Frequency - 1 per 500m3 with at least 1 test per 0.5m lift per 20m run of wall
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Proofroll of each layer. 4 Cleggs to be undertaken per NDM test.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum average value over 5 tests of 5 blows per 100mm, minimum single value of 4 blows per 100mm
Frequency - 1 per 500m3, 1 test per 0.5m lift per 20m run of wall

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Settlement pins shall be installed within 24 hours of reaching design subgrade level. Survey measurements are to be undertaken to within an accuracy of 2mm. Results must be provided to the Engineer within 24 hours of each reading.
Verifying Document - Survey Results (in paper as well as electronic format)
Frequency - Weekly for the first month, then monthly

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Targets shall be fixed immediately after completion of the first row of retaining wall blocks at each location and the initial baseline survey reading made prior to the subsequent row of retaining wall blocks placed.
○ Survey measurements are to be undertaken to within an accuracy of 2mm. Results must be provided to the Engineer within 24 hours of each reading.
Verifying Document - Survey Results (in paper as well as electronic format)
Frequency - Weekly for the first month, then monthly
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geotechnical engineer assesment required before commencement of Pavement construction
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Draft as-builts completed on the completion of MSE wall including red pen mark up to IFC drawing changes.

○ The draft as-builts shall be provided on a continual basis throughout the project for verification by the Engineer, and as a minimum shall be provided in electronic form prior to application for Practical Completion.
